text: this was the moment today on the Greek
island of Kos when tensions boiled over
amidst the heat and the desperation
recently arrived migrants at the end of
their tether even small children were
caught up in the chaos here a toddler
being handed through the door perhaps to
safety all these people descending on a
local sports stadium in the hope of
getting registered and securing the all
important papers they need to leave the
island we want only to go from this
island because we live in a miserable
way no bathrooms no tears no blesses to
sleep in before long it began to get
nasty local police apparently unable to
cope with the flood of applicants
resorted to violence they note here that
this officer then says sorry the police
also sprayed the crowd with fire
extinguishers releasing a choking fog of
white powder it's the second day tempers
have slapped yesterday this police
officer was suspended after brandishing
a knife and slapping someone the local
mayor says the situation on a course is
slipping out of control for these people
many refugees from Syria it's not the
reception they dreamt of in Europe what
can I say is this Europe if this is
Europe we're going back to Syria and for
those who do make it off course no
guarantee that elsewhere on the
continent they'll all get the Welcome
they'd hoped for Bridget handle BBC News
